org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support
Class AeCoordinationContainer

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeAbstractBpelObject
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support.AeCoordinationContainer
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeBpelObject, IAeExecutableBpelObject, IAeExecutableQueueItem, IAeFunctionFactory, IAeLocatableObject, IAeNamespaceContext, IAeVisitable
public class AeCoordinationContainer
extends AeAbstractBpelObject

Support container to manage coordinated acitivites for a scope.

Field Summary
static java.lang.String COORD_STATE_ACTIVE
          Indicates the activity is active.
static java.lang.String COORD_STATE_CANCELED
          Indicates that an 'active' activity has been sent a cancel signal due to fault/comp handler execution.

private  java.util.Map mRegsiteredCoordinations
          Map containing a set of all registered coordination-ids (key) along with the state information (value).

Constant Field Values

mActiveCoordinations

private java.util.Set mActiveCoordinations
Contains a set of coordination ids of activities which are currently executing (i.e has not completed, or faulted). A scope cannot complete until all coordinated activities have completed.

mRegsiteredCoordinations

private java.util.Map mRegsiteredCoordinations
Map containing a set of all registered coordination-ids (key) along with the state information (value).

mCompCoordinationsMap

private java.util.Map mCompCoordinationsMap
Map containing a set of coordination-ids (key) to compensationHandler (value) of coordinated activities which have a compensation handler associated with them.

restoreCoordination

public void restoreCoordination(java.lang.String aCoordinationId,
                                java.lang.String aState)
Restores the coordination and its state. This method is normally used by the state restoration process.

Parameters:
aCoordinationId - coordination id
aState - state of the coordination.

hasActiveCoordinations

public boolean hasActiveCoordinations()
Returns true if there are any activities remaining under active coordination. Coordinations that have either completed or faulted are not considered active.

Returns:
True if there are any activities remaining under active coordination

hasCoordinations

public boolean hasCoordinations()
Returns true if there any coordinated activities (either active, completed or faulted).

Returns:
True if there any coordinated activities.

registerCoordinationId

public void registerCoordinationId(java.lang.String aCoordinationId)
                            throws AeCoordinationException
Adds the coordination-id to the currently 'active' set. The id is added when a participant registers for coordination.

Parameters:
aCoordinationId -
Throws:
AeCoordinationException

deregisterCoordinationId

public void deregisterCoordinationId(java.lang.String aCoordinationId)
Removes the coordination-id from either the active or completed set.. The id is removed when a participant has reached the ENDED state.

Parameters:
aCoordinationId -

cancelActiveCoordinations

public void cancelActiveCoordinations()
Signals active coordinations to cancel or compensate (if the participant has completed). The state of these coordinations will be transistioned to canceled.

getCompensationHandlers

protected java.util.List getCompensationHandlers()
Returns a list of compensation handlers

checkForCompletion

private void checkForCompletion()
Checks to see if there are any remaining activities which have not completed or faulted. If all of the activities have completed, this method calls back on the Scope::coordinationCompleted() method.

callbackOnCompletion

public void callbackOnCompletion()
Invoked by the scope to indicate that it has finished its activity and retuires a callback when all active coordinations have completed.

getChildrenForStateChange

public java.util.Iterator getChildrenForStateChange()
Description copied from interface: IAeBpelObject
Returns an Iterator for the bpel object's child objects which participate in the state change propagation. For structured activities, this merely returns an Iterator for the child activity or activities. In some cases though, like Scope, we're returning objects in addition to the single child activity. This is because scope needs to propagate the

Returns:
Iterator containing IAeBpelObjets
See Also:
IAeBpelObject.getChildrenForStateChange()

getLocationPath

public java.lang.String getLocationPath()
This is overridden because we don't have a def object. Our location path is equal to the parent's path plus _CoordinationContainer

Specified by:
getLocationPath in interface IAeLocatableObject
Overrides:
getLocationPath in class AeAbstractBpelObject
See Also:
IAeLocatableObject.getLocationPath()

getDefinition

public AeBaseDef getDefinition()
This object gets created because there was no compensation handler defined for the scope. As such, there is no definition object and calling this method results in an exception.

Overrides:
getDefinition in class AeAbstractBpelObject
See Also:
AeAbstractBpelObject.getDefinition()
